pkgmetadata.longdescription: Bayesian Meta Analysis for Studying Cross-Phenotype Genetic Associations // A Bayesian meta-analysis method for studying cross-phenotype genetic associations. It uses summary-level data across multiple phenotypes to simultaneously measure the evidence of aggregate-level pleiotropic association and estimate an optimal subset of traits associated with the risk locus. CPBayes is based on a spike and slab prior and is implemented by Markov chain Monte Carlo technique Gibbs sampling.
